class.name: ZIPPacker
class.brief_description: Allows the creation of ZIP files.
class.description:
This class implements a writer that allows storing the multiple blobs in a ZIP archive. See also [ZIPReader] and [PCKPacker]. [codeblock] # Create a ZIP archive with a single file at its root. func write_zip_file(): var writer = ZIPPacker.new() var err = writer.open("user://archive.zip") if err != OK: return err writer.start_file("hello.txt") writer.write_file("Hello World".to_utf8_buffer()) writer.close_file()
writer.close() return OK [/codeblock]

method.name: close
method.description: Closes the underlying resources used by this instance.

method.name: close_file
method.description: Stops writing to a file within the archive. It will fail if there is no open file.

method.name: open
method.description: Opens a zip file for writing at the given path using the specified write mode. This must be called before everything else.

method.name: start_file
method.description: Starts writing to a file within the archive. Only one file can be written at the same time. Must be called after [method open].

method.name: write_file
method.description: Write the given [param data] to the file. Needs to be called after [method start_file].

constants.constant: Create a new zip archive at the given path.
Append a new zip archive to the end of the already existing file at the given path.
Add new files to the existing zip archive at the given path.
